page.title: 19RESERVATIONS ON CLIFTON
page.content: Eric Longley dislikes 1985 Clifton.Now in his late thirties Eric spent his childhood in a Clifton cottage and remembers the building of Clifton Estate.On re-visiting this large dormitory suburb he expresses regret.He sees the area as{"Planning {Vandalism"}and provides willing testimony to an "erosion of a lot of good things. He regrets the passing of a once teeming wildlife and bitterly resents the despoliation of{Clifton Grove-}a wooded local beauty spot.More significant is the decline he notices over the years in peoples values and attitudes.He comments on the prevalence of vandalism,social isolation and perceived selfishness in the community.
